title: [Large-Scale] RME Microlearning for Improving Statistics-Based Mathematical Communication Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistical concepts (mean, distribution, graph interpretation) and fundamental mobile device usage skills
context.additional_context: Activity-centered design using mobile apps in BYOD environments, linking statistical concepts to real job scenarios for job-seeking students in vocational training institutions

learning_goals: Learners will draft a logical report explaining work scenarios by analyzing statistical data.
Learners will provide constructive feedback based on the RME (Realistic Mathematics Education) approach to peersâ€™ statistical interpretations with at least 80% accuracy.
Learners will use mobile apps to represent real-world problems (sales trends, customer satisfaction, etc.) as statistical models and generate visualizations.

resources: Mobile-Compatible Statistical Tools (e.g., Desmos, Google Data Studio)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
